bug.author: ShikiGami
bug.description: I compiled Open3D on windows, and I've been experiencing some weird crashes while running the tutorials. One of the more annoying ones is one where from time to time the application just crashes when calling draw_geometries . It shows a blank window, and seems to be "loading something" but then it just crashes. The weird thing is that it isn't constant at all. Running the same sample multiple times, some times it crashes and some times it doesn't. I've been trying to run the VS debuger on it, but the application dies before I can run the VS debuger.

comments.comment: For better understanding the issue, can you tell me your environment (windows version and visual studio version) and the script makes runtime error? For your reference, we are testing Open3D on windows 8+ and Visual studio 2015 SP3+.

My enviroment: Windows 10 Pro (1709) Visual Studio 2017 (15.6.6) I'm building and installing Open3D with the new CMake support included in Visual Studio 2017 using the Ninja generator, as a msvc_x86 Release Build. It is a Runtime error that crashes the application, and just a few moments ago I was able to get a read of what is going on with the VS debugger, and it's calming to be an unhanded exception of what seems to be a memory access violation error occurring when calling some Eigen function. It's marking as a breaking point the line 35 of ProductsEvaluators.h

The last call before the error seems to be: Eigen::internal::evaluator<Eigen::Product<Eigen::Product<Eigen::Matrix<float,4,4,0,4,4>,Eigen::Matrix<float,4,4,0,4,4>,0>,Eigen::Matrix<float,4,4,0,4,4>,1> >(const Eigen::Product<Eigen::Product<Eigen::Matrix<float,4,4,0,4,4>,Eigen::Matrix<float,4,4,0,4,4>,0>,Eigen::Matrix<float,4,4,0,4,4>,1> & xpr)

Just note. I tried to regenerate the issue, but no luck so far. I am using windows10 + cmake3.11.1 + anaconda 64bit based python 3.6. Edit:
The issue arises when I used 32bit build. The issue is described here: http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/dox-devel/group__TopicUnalignedArrayAssert.html

Some updates: This especially happens in windows 32bit machine. As <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ShikiGami>@ShikiGami</denchmark-link> and I noted above, it arose from Eigen. Check <denchmark-link:http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/dox-devel/group__TopicUnalignedArrayAssert.html>Cause 1: Structures having Eigen objects as members</denchmark-link> . If class has fixed size vectors, such as the class is no longer memory aligned with SSE format. This crashes an app with segfault error. I was able to resolve the issue for some point by adding <denchmark-code>public: EIGEN_MAKE_ALIGNED_OPERATOR_NEW </denchmark-code>
in ViewControl class. However, the issue is not completely resolved. Actually, I am not big fan of adding this macro for every classes. I am curious why this issue not happens in 64bit machines. ðŸ˜›

Reporting in that this is still a problem. Windows 10, Python 3.7.3 32-bit and Open3D via pip install. Crashes as soon as I use draw_geometries or any visualization method that spawns a window. It is sporadic just as the OP claims. Stopped crashing as soon as i re-installed Python 64-bit and got the 64-bit packages via pip install.
32bits are no longer supported by new releases of Open3D
